meta.name: keywords
meta.content: Jeopardy Archive John Matthews Ricky Leiter Stephanie Jass Final clue response question answer Daily Double

meta.name: description
meta.content: An archive of clues and players for Jeopardy! show #6456.

td.p: John Matthews, a camp counselor and law student from McLean, Virginia
Ricky Leiter, a resident physician in internal medicine from New York, New York
Stephanie Jass, a history professor from Milan, Michigan (whose 5-day cash winnings total $98,970)

tr.td: SING US A SONG, YOU'RE THE PIANO MAN
(Alex: A visit to Ford's Theatre to explore one of the most tragic events in American history.)

div.onmouseout: toggle('clue_J_1_1', 'clue_J_1_1_stuck', '"Beastly" tool consisting of a metal wire fed into curved pipes to remove an obstruction')

a.title: Suggest a correction for this clue

tr.td: "Beastly" tool consisting of a metal wire fed into curved pipes to remove an obstruction

div.onmouseout: toggle('clue_J_6_1', 'clue_J_6_1_stuck', '(Alex walks the stage of Ford\'s Theatre in Washington, D.C.) President Lincoln arrived late at Ford\'s Theatre; the show was already under way, but when he was spotted walking down the stairs toward the presidential box, everything here stopped; then the orchestra struck up "Hail To The Chief", the audience gave him a thunderous round of applause, the president waved & bowed, & then the performance of this play continued')

a.title: Suggest a correction for this clue

tr.td: (Alex walks the stage of Ford's Theatre in Washington, D.C.) President Lincoln arrived late at Ford's Theatre; the show was already under way, but when he was spotted walking down the stairs toward the presidential box, everything here stopped; then the orchestra struck up "Hail To The Chief", the audience gave him a thunderous round of applause, the president waved & bowed, & then the performance of this play continued

div.onmouseout: toggle('clue_J_6_2', 'clue_J_6_2_stuck', '(Alex stands on the stage of Ford\'s Theatre in Washington, D.C.) Police work in those days could be a little bit shoddy: hours after the murder, a man named William Kent came back to the presidential box looking for his keys; what he found was the murder weapon, the small .44-caliber single-shot pistol bearing the name of this Philadelphia gunsmith who invented it')

a.title: Suggest a correction for this clue

tr.td: (Alex stands on the stage of Ford's Theatre in Washington, D.C.) Police work in those days could be a little bit shoddy: hours after the murder, a man named William Kent came back to the presidential box looking for his keys; what he found was the murder weapon, the small .44-caliber single-shot pistol bearing the name of this Philadelphia gunsmith who invented it

Illustrating the difference in memories, some people said that Booth shouted this Latin phrase right from here, center stage; others said, "No, it was from the box"; Booth himself wrote that he spoke the words before shooting Lincoln; perhaps he said these words more than once')

tr.td: (Alex walks the stage of Ford's Theatre in Washington, D.C.) Illustrating the difference in memories, some people said that Booth shouted this Latin phrase right from here, center stage; others said, "No, it was from the box"; Booth himself wrote that he spoke the words before shooting Lincoln; perhaps he said these words more than once

div.onmouseout: toggle('clue_J_6_4', 'clue_J_6_4_stuck', '(Alex reports from the Petersen House in Washington, D.C.) While Mrs. Lincoln and her friends sat vigil here in the front parlor, in the back parlor, this energetic Secretary of War took charge of the investigation and worked tirelessly through the night, coordinating the manhunt for John Wilkes Booth & his accomplices')

a.title: Suggest a correction for this clue

tr.td: (Alex reports from the Petersen House in Washington, D.C.) While Mrs. Lincoln and her friends sat vigil here in the front parlor, in the back parlor, this energetic Secretary of War took charge of the investigation and worked tirelessly through the night, coordinating the manhunt for John Wilkes Booth & his accomplices

div.h3: Scores at the end of the Double Jeopardy! Round:

div.onmouseover:
toggle('clue_FJ', 'clue_FJ_stuck', '(Alex: That Vegas heist movie starred Frank Sinatra.)
...
(Alex: Ocean\'s Eleven was the film.)
RickyWhat is 50/50?
$2,000
JohnWhat is Catch-22?
$1,900
StephanieWhat is Catch 22?
$4,000
Catch-22')
div.onmouseout: toggle('clue_FJ', 'clue_FJ_stuck', 'A proposed title for this novel sounded too much like a Vegas heist movie, so the number in the title was doubled')

tr.td: A proposed title for this novel sounded too much like a Vegas heist movie, so the number in the title was doubled

body.div: The J! Archive is created by fans, for fans. The Jeopardy! game show and all elements thereof, including but not limited to copyright and trademark thereto, are the property of Jeopardy Productions, Inc. and are protected under law.
